title: October Xplore Photo Contest
text: October Xplore Photo Contest 1. The last rays of sunlight illuminate the beauty of a simple set of silos in Nunn. Courtesy of Shannon Locke 2. A spotting scope reveals the details of the eclipsed moon as it reemerges. Courtesy of Shannon Locke 3. Darkness looms as the total lunar eclipse begins. Courtesy of Shannon Locke Fullscreen 4, This shot was taken on the first day of October during a 325 mile week-long bike tour of the San Juans at the peak of fall colors. Pictured cyclist is Wade Moore of Durango who helped plan the tour. "Colorado at its finest!" Courtesy of Amy Ehrenberger 5. Fall colors outside Colorado State University's Mountain Campus (Pingree Park). "I just had to pull over and try to capture the beauty of autumn in the Rockies." Courtesy of Mary Hill 6. An aspen grove near Trail Ridge Road in Rocky Mountain National Park. Courtesy of Jim Carlson 7. A bull elk bugling in Moraine Park in Rocky Mountain National Park, protecting his cows from four younger bull elk. Courtesy of Richard Kohlman 8. Fall colors entering their final days along the Poudre River before the onset of winter truly comes. Courtesy of Steven Conley 9. Strolling along the Big Thompson River. Courtesy of Wendy Jones 10. "We spent the afternoon is Estes Park enjoying the October weather and gorgeous views." Courtesy of Wendy Jones 11. "My son and I spent the afternoon walking along the river and taking his Senior portraits in beautiful Fort Collins." Courtesy of Wendy Jones 13. Autumn beauty in Legacy Park in Fort Collins. Courtesy of Wendy Jones 13. Sprague Lake at night with a long exposure looking toward Hallett Peak and Flattop Mountain in Rocky Mountain National Park. Courtesy of Richard Kohlman 14. The drive to Crested Butte from Fort Collins. Courtesy of Mary Liss 15. "My husband and I were driving home from a couple of days in Steamboat Springs. We were on Hwy 40 just past Rabbit Ears Pass." Courtesy of Linda L Johnson 16. Aspen turning gold on the way up to Deadman Fire lookout tower in Red Feather Lakes. Courtesy of Shelly Denison 17. The fall colors of Crested Butte. Courtesy of Mary Liss 18. Fall arrives in Crested Butte. Courtesy of Mary Liss 19. Cherrie Thornton had never visited Sprague Lake in Rocky Mountain Park before. "Loved the view and the reflections in the lake." Courtesy of Cherrie Thornton 20. The fall colors pop as seen from the Bierstadt Lake Trail in Rocky Mountain National Park. Courtesy of Ellen Edwards 21. The single aspen trunk is surrounded by a riot of colorful leaves in Moraine Park. Courtesy of Mike Fox 22. The lone aspen stands out in the pine forest in Rocky Mountain National Park's Moraine Park. Courtesy of Mike Fox 23. A bluebird poses on a blue-colored boulder in Moraine Park in Rocky Mountain National Park. Courtesy of Mike Fox 24. The bull elk was moving across a ridge line with hazy mountains in the background. Courtesy of Mike Fox Fullscreen 25. "I took a few minutes up by the Alluvial Fan to work on my blurring technique of the river flowing smoothly down through and over the boulders. I liked that I was able to get some of the aspen to frame the top of the image." Courtesy of Norm Keally 26. "While walking through a meadow I noticed a colorful group of aspen in front of me with more on the hillside behind and wonderful blue skies! " Courtesy of Norm Keally "Great fall colors and clouds casting shadows on the mountains. How could I pass up a photo like this?" Courtesy of Roy McBride 28. Emerald Lake in Crested Butte. "Drove up narrow, bumpy Gothic Road but view at the lake was breathtaking!" Courtesy of Mary Liss 29. This bull elk in Rocky Mountain National Park's Moraine Park approached the reclining female and began caressing her. Courtesy of Mike Fox 30. The sun rises over Fort Collins. Courtesy of Lois Winegarner 31. View of Longs Peak. "We were searching for color in Rocky Mountain Park and just enjoying the day." Courtesy of Cherrie Thornton 32. Autumn color on Kebler Pass. Courtesy of Susan Bush 33. Aspen trees show their colors in Cottonwood Canyon near Buena Vista. Courtesy of Richard Kohlman 34. A bridge spans the Fraser River in Granby. Courtesy of Diana Warberg 35. The evening sun casts its glow on the foothills plains. Courtesy of Jason Caskey 36. Red Mountain Open Space in early October. Courtesy of Teri Kman 37. The late afternoon sun over Golden Meadows Pond in south Fort Collins. Courtesy of Kevin Keane 38. Just off the trail between Sprague Lake and Glacier Gorge Junction in Rocky Mountain National Park. Looking to Flattop Mountain and Hallett Peak. Courtesy of Pete Bullard 39. Fort Collins, as seen from the fifth floor of the Larimer Courthouse offices. Courtesy of Lois Winegarner 40. Fall colors are abound in Fort Collins, as trees explode in golden color on Mountain Avenue. Courtesy of Lois Winegarner 41. The evening sun casts a golden glow on this classic gate off Larimer County Road 5. Courtesy of Shannon Locke 42. Watson Lake, near Bellvue. Courtesy of Kim Keiss 43. Fall colors at Horsetooth Mountain Park. Courtesy of Mark Near 44. Fall colors in Rocky Mountain National Park. Courtesy of Mark Near 45. Signs of fall: a John Deere tractor is draped in golden leaves and sits next to a pair of pumpkins. Courtesy of Robert Jaramillo 46. "I decided I'd be happier out of the truck when the crew turned the truck around on the narrow, steep road." At Emerald Lake in Crested Butte. Courtesy of Mary Liss 47. "Celebrating Mom's milestone birthday." Courtesy of Mary Liss Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
